title: I have bought a Raspberry Pi 3, and I have a laptop running Ubuntu. What other devices do I need to get started? - Quora

response.answer_text: To try out Raspberry PI, a laptop is good enough. To use the Raspberry PI as a independent system, you would need a monitor (HDM for direct connection), KB and a mouse. A USB hub will be of great help (else you would have to disconnect USB devices every time you move around the raspi). Further, you would need many other add ons(eg., Sensors and interfacing card in case of IoT) as you start with project. It all depends on what you want to use PI for !

The first thing you need is a good power supply of greater than 2Amps .Then a SD card preferably 8GB and above with any Operating System of your choice (Raspbhian,Ubuntu Mate,Kodi,Win10 IOT core,Arch Linux) etc .Then for 1st time setup you need a display,mouse and keyboard .Then when you hop onto desktop of Pi enable SSH and you can then run it headless .
